snippet: Some Republicans complain of a tilt toward Obama in the polls. But in elections past, the forecasts have overestimated on both sides.
abstract: FiveThirtyEight blog contends that complaints by some Republicans, who say that polls are tilted toward Pres Obama, are largely unsound; notes that accusations of political bias have been common among trailing parties in past elections.
lead_paragraph: Some Republicans complain of a tilt toward Obama in the polls. But in elections past, the forecasts have overestimated on both sides.

headline.seo: Last 10 Presidential Elections Show No Consistent Bias in Polls
headline.main: Last 10 Presidential Elections Show No Consistent Bias in Polls
headline.print_headline: Last 10 Presidential Elections Show No Consistent Bias in Polls
